\section{board module}

\section{hints module}
\label{\detokenize{hints:module-hints}}\label{\detokenize{hints:hints-module}}\label{\detokenize{hints::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!hints@\spxentry{hints}}\index{hints@\spxentry{hints}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{HintsData (class in hints)@\spxentry{HintsData}\spxextra{class in hints}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{hints:hints.HintsData}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{hints.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{HintsData}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{dim}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{topHint}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{]}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{botHint}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{]}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{rightHint}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{]}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{leftHint}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{]}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
HintsData class contains input data, which are indicators of
how many pyramids can be seen from a given position.

\sphinxAtStartPar
There are four types of hints: topHint, botHint, rightHint, leftHint.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Along with that is the dim parameter that will determine the size of
the problem.
\index{checkDim() (hints.HintsData static method)@\spxentry{checkDim()}\spxextra{hints.HintsData static method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar

\section{condition\_analysis module}
\label{\detokenize{condition_analysis:module-condition_analysis}}\label{\detokenize{condition_analysis:condition-analysis-module}}\label{\detokenize{condition_analysis::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!condition\_analysis@\spxentry{condition\_analysis}}\index{condition\_analysis@\spxentry{condition\_analysis}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{CondBoard (class in condition\_analysis)@\spxentry{CondBoard}\spxextra{class in condition\_analysis}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{condition_analysis:condition_analysis.CondBoard}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{condition\_analysis.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{CondBoard}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{dim}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{board}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{]}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: {\hyperref[\detokenize{board:board.Board}]{\sphinxcrossref{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Board}}}}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
This is a class that inherits from the Board class,
where each cell of the board is a list instead of an integer.
This class will analyze the suggested dataset and generate a
list of values that can be put in each board cell, improving
time and memory when creating configurations.
\index{noSolutionCheck() (condition\_analysis.CondBoard static method)@\spxentry{noSolutionCheck()}\spxextra{condition\_analysis.CondBoard static method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{condition_analysis:condition_analysis.CondBoard.noSolutionCheck}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{static\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{noSolutionCheck}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{hint}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{list}}}{{ $\rightarrow$ bool}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check if the list of hints has the ability to give a solution
The problem has no solution if there is more than one value
1 or N in the list.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{hint}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} List of hints

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
This problem have solution or not?

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
bool

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{topCond() (condition\_analysis.CondBoard method)@\spxentry{topCond()}\spxextra{condition\_analysis.CondBoard method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}

\pysigstartsignatures

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Analyze and eliminate impossibility based on type one hints.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{topHint}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{list}}) \textendash{} List of type one hints

\sphinxlineitem{Raises}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{InsufficientData}} \textendash{} exception \sphinxhyphen{} raise when missing data occurs

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{NoSolutionError}} \textendash{} exception \sphinxhyphen{} raise when there is no             satisfactory solution to this hint

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{remRedundantCond() (condition\_analysis.CondBoard method)@\spxentry{remRedundantCond()}\spxextra{condition\_analysis.CondBoard method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{condition_analysis:condition_analysis.CondBoard.remRedundantCond}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{remRedundantCond}}}{}{{ $\rightarrow$ None}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Since the above four methods are not executed concurrently,
it is possible to result in some impossibility of configuration
that has not been eliminated. This method will “double check”
and delete it.

\end{fulllineitems}

\section{board\_resolver module}
\label{\detokenize{board_resolver:module-board_resolver}}\label{\detokenize{board_resolver:board-resolver-module}}\label{\detokenize{board_resolver::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!board\_resolver@\spxentry{board\_resolver}}\index{board\_resolver@\spxentry{board\_resolver}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{BoardResolver (class in board\_resolver)@\spxentry{BoardResolver}\spxextra{class in board\_resolver}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{board_resolver:board_resolver.BoardResolver}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{board\_resolver.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{BoardResolver}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{hints=\textless{}hints.HintsData object\textgreater{}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Bases: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{object}}

\sphinxAtStartPar
BoardResolver class stores the data of a problem, including the
input data: hints, the condition board and the problem results
(if it’s exist). It also includes methods that are used as tools
to solve the problem from input data.
\index{flag (board\_resolver.BoardResolver property)@\spxentry{flag}\spxextra{board\_resolver.BoardResolver property}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{board_resolver:board_resolver.BoardResolver.flag}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{property\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{flag}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
This flag marks if the current object is storing the
configuration as the solution of the problem or not.
If flag is 0, then no solution has been found yet, and vice
versa if flag is 1
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
value of flag

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
int

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{curBrd (board\_resolver.BoardResolver property)@\spxentry{curBrd}\spxextra{board\_resolver.BoardResolver property}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{board_resolver:board_resolver.BoardResolver.curBrd}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysigline{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{property\DUrole{w}{  }}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{curBrd}}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Current configuration of the board for the problem.
By default, all cells in the board have a value of 0. If flag = 1,
then this property is the answer to the problem.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Current configuration of the board

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{numVisiblePyramids() (board\_resolver.BoardResolver static method)@\spxentry{numVisiblePyramids()}\spxextra{board\_resolver.BoardResolver static method}}

\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculates the length of the longest incremented sequence
that starts with the first element of the array.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Used to calculate how many pyramids can be seen at the
specified location.

(found the answer)

\index{checkResultWithCond() (board\_resolver.BoardResolver method)@\spxentry{checkResultWithCond()}\spxextra{board\_resolver.BoardResolver method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{board_resolver:board_resolver.BoardResolver.checkResultWithCond}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{checkResultWithCond}}}{}{{ $\rightarrow$ bool}}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Check if the current configuration of the object is satisfied with
the input condition.

\sphinxAtStartPar
At each row/column, we will get the list of values of that row/column,
calculate how many pyramids we can see with this configuration and
compare it with the corresponding hint (if the hint is not 0).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Is the answer right or wrong?

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
bool

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{backtracking() (board\_resolver.BoardResolver method)@\spxentry{backtracking()}\spxextra{board\_resolver.BoardResolver method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{board_resolver:board_resolver.BoardResolver.backtracking}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{backtracking}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{row}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{col}\DUrole{p}{:}\DUrole{w}{  }\DUrole{n}{int}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Backtracking algorithm, where the problem is solved.
This algorithm will generate all possible configurations of the board
(based on the condition board and the values that have already been
placed in the board) until it finds a match.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{row}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} current row that the algorithm considers

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{col}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{int}}) \textendash{} current column that the algorithm considers

\end{itemize}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{resolver() (board\_resolver.BoardResolver method)@\spxentry{resolver()}\spxextra{board\_resolver.BoardResolver method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{board_resolver:board_resolver.BoardResolver.resolver}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{resolver}}}{}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Method prepares the condition table and calls
the method to solve the problem.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Raises}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{NoSolutionError}} \textendash{} exception \sphinxhyphen{} can’t find the solution

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\end{fulllineitems}
